name: My Lands: Black Gem Hunting
description: My Lands is a free online RTS where dark and light forces fight for Black Gem and dominion in a vast fantasy world. Cooperation between players, joint economy development, creation of clans and alliances and elaboration of a team strategy serve as the very foundation of the game.
minimum_requirements: OS: WindowsÂ® 7 / Vista / Vista64 / XP Processor: Pentium 4 2.5GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Seems to be a good F2P real strategy game; Unique graphics, I quite enjoy the style.  No music (I don't really need it as the longer you play this game the less you have to be on because building times and such get higher and higher) Some people are falsely claiming that you have to wait 3 days for a building to go from Level 2 to 3 what's totally wrong. You can adjust the laborers you have who build your city and adjusting the amount of laborers changes the build time. I have to wait about 2 hours with 320 builders to achieve level 3 Castle. Microtransactions; Seems to be evened out quite nicely, no massive P2W stuff except that you can buy higher production rate what gives you an advantage over other players.  I have yet to explore the attacking part of the game.
It's too expensive for such a crappy casual FB game.

It's a good game to pass some of your free time, per say at work.  Pros: -You can't loose your cities. -Enemies can't force you to move away from territory. -Level-based enemies ensure, that you won't be attacked early on. -Level-based enemies ensure, that you can't attack much weaker players. -It's not a P2W. Buy-able things aren't going to help you win against others that much! -Usage of Closing Gates prevents enemies to attack you!  Cons: -Researching does take quite a lot of time. -Research does cost much at high level, which brings the game to a halt, unless you pay. -Large armies requiring time to feed. -At maximum level you can be attacked by the top players. -Equipment for your heroes are OVER-priced. OVER-priced. Only the best can afford them. -Equipment for your heroes cost so much, that is not worth the irl $. Totally OVER-priced.  Suggestion: Worth to try it out! If it's magic captures you, you'll be liking it. A nice way to spend 30 minutes of the day.

this is my first reviw of any game.. and i have been around steam for a few years...  i rait NO to My Lands Black Gem Hunting.. for several reasons.. and i have over 145 hours on this game  1) the player base is 75% russian.. that in it self is not a bad thing... but 90% of the in game mails you send to people.. answer back 'no english'... ok as i speak only english that is my problem i know.... but as a vast majority of the high ranked players are russian... when you finaly claw your way to the top ranking....you dont stay long.  2) i played on both servers... at one point soon after steam release... there was aprox 9000+ players on each server.. now there is aprox 3500 and at any given point 700+ online... and the stats for active kingdoms keep falling..  3) this game was released back in 2011.. it is 2014.... it almost plays like a Face book game... without the face book.. the cost for Black Gems. if you buy them in real life cash..... is heartbreaking... the devolpers claime that the Rank 7 ruins have up to 100k black gems in them.. i am at the stage where i can kill rank 5 ruins (with about 5% losses and much planing) i have not found a rank 7 ruin yet... but the rank 6 ruins have about 3x the troops that a rank 5 does.. and about 20-30 Black gems in them....  THEY WANT YOU TO SPEND REAL LIFE MONEY on the game....  so yes... i am a bit upset that after finally making 5 star rank... i get totaly destroyed by a whole allaince attacking me .. they send therir lower ranked people to kill buildings and defensives.. and as a higer ranked player you cant do anything to stop them but hide your troops and try to rebuild... but that is a loosing proposition... so when you try to fight back.. the players that are the same rank as you.. (remember thy lower ranked has alread devistated your defenses) the attack and kill off all your troops... now you have to rebuild EVERYTHING all over...   since this game is based on ALL attack... all rankings are based on wining attacks... there is nothing based on trying to defend... no defensive states... and no real defensive stratagies except for staying small and not letting the ranked players attack... at that is the real reason i give this game a NO.... the game has no balance
Generic Free-to-Play but Pay-to-Win, Facebook tier MMO. Even if you enjoy playing games like this and don't mind wasting tons of money, there are much better alternatives.  1/10

Cons :  -Flash Game, -no sound & Music -pay to win -worse than any other facebook game type  Pros :  None , until there are new playfire award  so why do I still spent so much time in this ? I'm hoping someday there will be a new playfire reward ;p

This game is a joke, terrible graphix, very weak structure, does not even have sounds or bg music of any kind And yet the DLC for it are among the most expensive for any game on steam, 100$ for what is basically a skin pack? all of the DLC add up to about 500$...  You can own a steam account with 200 games for that amount of money. A steam account with  GOOD  games, that people actually put some work in, not games that doesn't even hold up to other browser game such as this one.  This game is so cash shop heavy you could finance a country with it; if you spent any of your money on this game you need to seek professional help, ask your family for an intervention, you've got problems.

It's just another browser based junk game with all of the flaws of these browsers games:  -pay to win -long stretches of time with nothing interesting happening -lots of abandoned players -newcomers are at a big disadvantage compared to the estabilished players  It does have steam achievements, but they're tedious too.

The worst pay 2 play game! If you're the type of gamer that likes to get achievements, then this game is not for you. You have to pay to enusre you get your achievements. One of them, you have to complete 150 quests, fail 6 of them, then you won't get the achievement. They happen to pull the timed quests on you that forces you to pay money to complete.  There is nothing of merit about this game. Graphics, music, gameplay, all of them are terrible.  If you happen to be unfortunate to have this ungodly abomination on your Steam, fear not. Just go to your account, view your licences and then revoke it.
Thanks for deleting my village! Really much appreciated!

horrible i hate it dont play it its so slow

Unfortunately, this game is not really free2play. Here's why: 'You should complete 150 tasks w/o loosing over 6 tasks in a row'. Seems easy enough when you start. You develop your castle, no hassle, everything seems to be fine. But then 'Bang! you have 24 hours to complete blah-blah-blah' and that 'blah-blah-blah' requires investing real money - 'choose your subscription plan'. Even more - the benefits the game offers in return doesn't seem to be really the needed ones. After 3 such occasions, with ever growing demands of investments - I can only say 'Booo!!!'. If you really want to play you're likely to find yourself spending sums comparable to AAA titles or even exceeding them. US$399 for some 'black gems'...  What's good in it? Support for multiple languages, works in win10, doesn't have any powerful 3d graphics, and probably that's all.  Such games are typically run in web browsers and don't have dedicated client.  The bad? It'll try to grab way over $10 out of your pocket.

It takes several real life hours just to upgrade a building or research a science unless you're willing to pay real money to upgrade them instantly. It will take you months to do what a paying player can do in a minute. A waste of time unless you want to drop a ton of real life cash on this game.

Granted, I'm not really giving this game much of a chance (only several hours). But do I need to? I've spent 99% of my time waiting for things to happen. It says, 'Here's a quest: click that thing and build it.' I do so. I wait several minutes to hours. Then it says, 'Here's another quest: click that other thing and build it.' I do so. I wait several minutes to hours. Rinse. Repeat. Realize that progress in this game is P2W, and incredibly tedious. Quit and write negative review.  I don't know how this game currently has 88% positive reviews, because it definitely isn't that good. Somebody may have rigged the reviews. My guess is that with time, that'll get down below 50%.  The mentorship system seems to be a broken one. Mentors gain rewards when their apprentices accomplish quests, but there is no motivation for the mentor to actually do anything to help the apprentice. You can request resources from the mentor, but they don't have to give them to you. I'm not sure, but it seems like you can't fire your mentor, either. Once you've accepted them, they own you, and leech off of you.  You should also be aware that no matter how much progress you've made in the game (even if you've been playing for years), they'll delete your kingdom if it's inactive for between 7-30 days. So... basically, what's the point of playing this?  How many more terrible design decisions are there that I'm not aware of, yet?  It's just too bad, because there's something very tempting about the slow-growth style of this game. But why waste any time on it if you'll just lose it all when real life happens?
